Quote Text: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote Text: If you want to live a happy life, tie it to a goal, not to people or things.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote Text: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to a focus.
Author: Alexander Graham Bell

Quote Text: How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.
Author: Annie Dillard

Quote Text: You may delay, but time will not.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote Text: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time, for that is the stuff life is made of.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote Text: Lost time is never found again.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote Text: If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote Text: The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote Text: The trouble is, you think you have time.
Author: Buddha
Source/Context: Attributed, often to Jack Kornfield's retelling

Quote Text: The Deep Work Hypothesis: The ability to perform deep work is becoming increasingly rare at exactly the same time it is becoming increasingly valuable in our economy.
Author: Cal Newport

Quote Text: Clarity about what matters provides clarity about what does not.
Author: Cal Newport

Quote Text: Stay afraid, but do it anyway. What's important is the action. You don't have to wait to be confident. Just do it and eventually the confidence will follow.
Author: Carrie Fisher

Quote Text: The present time has one advantage over every other – it is our own.
Author: Charles Caleb Colton
Source/Context: Lacon, Or, Many Things in Few Words

Quote Text: Procrastination is the thief of time.
Author: Edward Young

Quote Text: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote Text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote Text: Some things are in our control and others not. Things in our control are opinion, pursuit, desire, aversion... whatever are our own actions.
Author: Epictetus

Quote Text: Men are disturbed, not by things, but by the principles and notions which they form concerning things.
Author: Epictetus

Quote Text: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it naturally happens.
Author: Epictetus

Quote Text: The mystery of human existence lies not in just staying alive, but in finding something to live for.
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

Quote Text: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote Text: Time is free, but it's priceless. You can't own it, but you can use it. You can't keep it, but you can spend it. Once you've lost it you can never get it back.
Author: Harvey Mackay

Quote Text: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived.
Author: Henry David Thoreau
Source/Context: Walden; or, Life in the Woods

Quote Text: The whole secret of a successful life is to find out what is one's destiny to do, and then do it.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote Text: Someday is not a day of the week.
Author: Janet Dailey

Quote Text: Wherever you are, be all there.
Author: Jim Elliot

Quote Text: A year from now you may wish you had started today.
Author: Karen Lamb

Quote Text: Until you value yourself, you will not value your time. Until you value your time, you will not do anything with it.
Author: M. Scott Peck

Quote Text: Think of your long procrastination, and of the many opportunities given you by the Gods, but left unused.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote Text: People who labor all their lives but have no purpose to direct every thought and impulse toward are wasting their time—even when hard at work.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote Text: You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote Text: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote Text: Our life is what our thoughts make it.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote Text: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote Text: Get busy with life's purpose, toss aside empty hopes, get active in your own rescue—if you care for yourself at all—and do it while you can.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote Text: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote Text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote Text: You don't have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quote Text: Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?
Author: Mary Oliver

Quote Text: The bad news is time flies. The good news is you're the pilot.
Author: Michael Altshuler

Quote Text: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote Text: Action is the foundational key to all success.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote Text: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote Text: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote Text: Intentional living is the art of making our own choices before others' choices make us.
Author: Richie Norton
Source/Context: The Power of Starting Something Stupid

Quote Text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
Author: Sam Levenson

Quote Text: It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it.
Author: Seneca the Younger

Quote Text: Putting things off is the biggest waste of life: it snatches away each day as it comes, and denies us the present by promising the future.
Author: Seneca the Younger

Quote Text: The whole future lies in uncertainty: live immediately.
Author: Seneca the Younger

Quote Text: You act like mortals in all that you fear, and like immortals in all that you desire.
Author: Seneca the Younger

Quote Text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
Author: Socrates

Quote Text: The secret of change is to focus all of your energy not on fighting the old, but on building the new.
Author: Socrates
Source/Context: Attributed, often to Dan Millman's retelling

Quote Text: The main thing is to keep the main thing the main thing.
Author: Stephen R. Covey

Quote Text: The key is not to prioritize your schedule but to schedule your priorities.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source/Context: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote Text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma—which is living with the results of other people's thinking.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote Text: Focus on being productive instead of busy.
Author: Tim Ferriss

Quote Text: What we fear doing most is usually what we most need to do.
Author: Tim Ferriss

Quote Text: ‘Someday’ is a disease that will take your dreams to the grave with you.
Author: Timothy Ferriss

Quote Text: Decide what kind of life you actually want. Then say no to everything that isn't that.
Author: Unknown

Quote Text: The best way to get something done is to begin.
Author: Unknown
